summary: This bill, the New Markets Tax Credit Extension Act of 2025, proposes to permanently extend the New Markets Tax Credit. It amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to remove the expiration date on the credit, adjust the credit for inflation after 2025, and provide alternative minimum tax relief. The amendments apply to tax years beginning after December 31, 2024, with specific effective dates for alternative minimum tax relief tied to qualified equity investments.
